description: A large public plaza on Fish-Man Island where the final battle between the Straw Hat Pirates and the New Fish-Man Pirates takes place. It's where Fukaboshi makes his emotional plea to Luffy to reset the island's history to zero.

keyEvents.title: Fukaboshi's 'Reset to Zero' Speech
keyEvents.description: Fukaboshi makes his tearful plea to Luffy at Gyoncorde Plaza, asking him to reset Fish-Man Island's history to zero.
keyEvents.significance: The emotional and thematic climax of the arc takes place at this location.

keyEvents.title: Luffy Accepts Fukaboshi's Request
keyEvents.description: Luffy accepts Fukaboshi's request at Gyoncorde Plaza, declaring Fish-Man Island as friends.
keyEvents.significance: Cements the alliance between the Straw Hats and the Ryugu Kingdom.

keyEvents.title: Franky Fireball Against Ikaros Much
keyEvents.description: Franky continues his battle with Ikaros Much at the plaza, debuting his Franky Fireball technique.

keyEvents.title: Chopper's Heavy Gong
keyEvents.description: Chopper battles Dosun at the plaza, revealing his improved Heavy Point form.

keyEvents.title: Zoro Dominates Hyouzou
keyEvents.description: Zoro effortlessly defeats Hyouzou at the plaza, cutting off his swords.
keyEvents.significance: Shows the power gap between the Straw Hats and Fish-Man Island's strongest.

keyEvents.title: Luffy Declares Friendship with Fish-Man Island
keyEvents.description: Luffy announces through the intercom from the plaza that the Straw Hats will protect Fish-Man Island.
keyEvents.significance: Officially establishes the Straw Hats as allies of Fish-Man Island.

statusHistory.reason: Main battlefield for the Fish-Man Island Arc conflict

description: A lawless slum area on Fish-Man Island where orphans and outcasts live. It's where anti-human sentiment is strongest and where Arlong and Hody Jones were raised. The area became a breeding ground for hatred against humans.

keyEvents.title: Young Hody Absorbs Anti-Human Propaganda
keyEvents.description: Flashback shows the Fish-Man District where young Hody and other future New Fish-Man Pirates officers listen to anti-human propaganda being preached on the streets.
keyEvents.significance: Reveals the origin of Hody's hatred and shows how the environment created monsters through inherited prejudice.

keyEvents.title: Hody and Officers Celebrate Otohime's Death
keyEvents.description: Flashback shows Hody and his officers in the Fish-Man District celebrating Queen Otohime's assassination.
keyEvents.significance: Shows the depth of their twisted ideology.

keyEvents.title: Hody Begins Producing Energy Steroids
keyEvents.description: After stealing a sample from the Tamatebako, Hody begins mass-producing Energy Steroids in the Fish-Man District.
keyEvents.significance: Shows the Fish-Man District as the base of operations for Hody's rebellion.

statusHistory.reason: Lawless district where anti-human sentiment breeds

description: An underwater island located 10,000 meters below sea level, beneath the Red Line. Home to fish-men and merfolk, it has a long history of discrimination and conflict with humans. The island is protected by a giant bubble.

keyEvents.title: Luffy Declares Friendship with Fish-Man Island
keyEvents.description: Luffy broadcasts to all of Fish-Man Island that the Straw Hats consider them friends and will protect the island.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes a formal alliance between the Straw Hats and Fish-Man Island, helping to heal centuries of distrust.
